page.title: 12Derwent Howe
page.content: In 1981 this was a slag bank for depositing blast furnace waste from the Workington{Iron and Steel Corporation complex at Moss Bay. Cumbria County Council receiving grants from the Department of the Environment and the European Regional Development Fund have began a major {reclamation scheme}of the 200 hectares of land. The old slag bank covered Chapel Hill with 30 metres of waste. Today the bank has been lowered 20 metres and regraded to look like natural hills. Derwent Howe will soon be a well landscaped{industrial park}with greenery, modern services and it is hoped busy firms. Some of the{public amenities}will be view points overlooking the Solway Firth, a ski slope, car parks, woodland and improvements to the Quay.
